item.title: Undeploy the applications
item.description: To delete the resources created by the applications, we should delete the application deployments and kubernetes dashboard. Note that if you followed the cleanup section of the modules, some of the commands below might fail because there is nothing to delete and its ok. Undeploy the applications: cd ~/environment/ecsdemo-frontend kubectl delete -f kubernetes/service.yaml kubectl delete -f kubernetes/deployment.yaml cd ~/environment/ecsdemo-crystal kubectl delete -f kubernetes/service.yaml kubectl delete -f kubernetes/deployment.yaml cd ~/environment/ecsdemo-nodejs kubectl delete -f kubernetes/service.

item.title: Delete the EKSCTL Cluster
item.description: In order to delete the resources created for this EKS cluster, run the following commands: Delete the cluster: eksctl delete cluster --name=eksworkshop-eksctl The nodegroup will have to complete the deletion process before the EKS cluster can be deleted. The total process will take approximately 15 minutes, and can be monitored via the CloudFormation Console

item.title: Cleanup the Workspace
item.description: Since we no longer need the Cloud9 instance to have Administrator access to our account, we can delete the workspace we created: Go to your Cloud9 Environment Select the environment named eksworkshop and pick delete
